title: brecon by election result boris lib dem win
story: A  per cent swing saw Jane Dodds romp to victory in the Welsh seat - a huge blow for Boris whose majority has now been slashed to just one.She secured . per cent of the vote in Brecon and Radnorshire - ahead of disgraced Tory MP Chris Davies on . per cent.But Tory Chairman James Cleverly told the BBC this morning: The Lib Dems with their dirty backroom deal, with Plaid and the Greens and others, threw the kitchen sink at this and got a narrow win. That is disappointing.He told the BBC the Lib Dems had scraped a win and the Tory candidate was very close to being elected.And he added in a plea to Brexiteers: If you vote for the Brexit Party, you will make it harder [to deliver Brexit].After topping the poll by , votes, winner Ms Dodds said: The people of this constituency have chosen hope over fear. We demand better.And encapsulating the threat to Brexit her victory poses, Ms Dodds added that her first act as an MP will be to demand a no-deal exit is ruled out.She said: People are desperately crying out for a dferent kind of politics.There is no time for tribalism when our country is faced with a Boris Johnson government and the threat of a no-deal Brexit.So my very first act as your MP when I arrive in Westminster will be to find Mr Boris Johnson wherever he is hiding and tell him loud and clear: Stop playing with the future of our communities and rule out a no-deal Brexit now.Lib Dem sources said this morning: Its a simple rule of politics -you stop listening, you lose touch and get punished.No doubt there is more of that to come.The by-election was called following the sacking of Mr Davies, , last month after more than , voters signed a recall petition.He had been convicted of submitting a  expenses claim - but was still chosen to fight to reclaim his seat by his local party.There were hopes that the Boris bounce in the polls could save the Tories from losing the Leave-voting mid-Wales constituency.But the defeat in Boris first election test - only  days after he took office, a record for a new PM - will be a headache for Number .The Tories now only have a majority of one - creating a fatal threat to PM Boris Brexit plan as it is steered through parliament.On his visit to Wales on Tuesday, Boris Johnson had warned: A vote for any party other than Conservatives pushes the Liberal Democrats one step closer to cancelling the referendum result.Now, just one MP deciding to abandon the party and join the Opposition could completely scupper efforts to deliver Brexit by October .Boris is also heavily reliant on the  votes of the Conservatives Northern Irish allies, the DUP, too.With the DUPs votes counted, the PM now has the support of  MPs - while opposition parties have .It was also a humiliating defeat for Labour - who narrowly avoided losing their deposit.Candidate Tom Davies limped behind in a dismal fourth place with just . per cent - beating only the Monster Raving Loony Party and UKIP.Support for Jeremy Corbyns party collapsed by . per cent - with Labour voters swarming to the Lib Dems and Brexit Party, who came third.But Jeremy Corbyn brushed it off on a visit to Scarborough this morning, saying it was obviously disappointing but theyd only won because Remainers teamed up.He added: The Liberal Democrats won it after doing a deal with Plaid Cymru and the Greens.I think that a lot of voters were determined to get rid of the Conservative, and they voted accordingly. So we were squeezed, but its a place we have not held for a very long time. The area has changed a bit.UKIP were pummelled into last place with just  votes - even losing out to the fth-place Monster Raving Loony Party.Turnout was at . per cent - the highest for a by-election in  years since Winchester in November .Ms Dodds - the partys leader in Wales - had been the bookies favourite going into the vote.She was helped by a pact with Plaid Cymru and the Green Party who decided not to contest the seat as part of a pro-Remain alliance.Following the by-election result, newly-elected Lib Dem leader Jo Swinson said: Boris Johnsons shrinking majority makes it clear that he has no mandate to crash us out of the EU.She added:  Voters don’t have to settle for Boris Johnson or Jeremy Corbyn - there is another positive alternative.Conservative candidate Mr Davies said his party had run a clean and positive campaign, adding: Sadly, a few of our competitors have led a dirty campaign.Ms Dodds said earlier her priorities are to stand up for Welsh farmers and oppose Tory cuts.She added: This by-election is, therefore, a choice between change with the Liberal Democrats or the same old broken politics with the Tories.The recall petition was triggered after Mr Davies was convicted in March for submitting two  expenses invoices.They were nine photographs costing £ to decorate his new office.A TORY MP is threatening to completely wipe out Boris Johnsons majority in Parliament by considering switching parties.Phillip Lee, a Remainer Tory who wants a second referendum, said hed be thinking hard about his political future over the summer break.Last night Boris lost one of his Tory MPs as the Lib Dems won the Brecon and Radnorshire seat in Wales, slashing his majority down.Mr Lee told a political podcast this week:The party I joined was the party of John Major and John Major, I think, is probably feeling like this judging by his contributions in recent weeks, he said.Im really not comfortable about my party pushing for no-deal Brexit without proper consent of the public.Purely on the national interest, I think its wrong to do this. But party politically I think its narrowing our base in a way that I dont see how we win elections.Im sort of sitting here, looking on and - yeah - Im going to spend the summer thinking a lot.He was fined £,, ordered to pay £, towards legal costs and told to carry out  hours of community service.But Mr Davies was later selected again by the Conservative Party - who wanted to portray his expenses rap as an honest mistake.He had represented the seat for the Conservatives since  - and his majority in  was ,. For the latest news on this story keep checking back at Sun Online.Thesun is your go to destination for the best celebrity news, football news, real-le stories, jaw-dropping pictures and must-see video.Download our fantastic, new and improved free App for the best ever Sun Online experience. title: saudi arabia allows women travel without permission
story: The new rule allows women over the age of  to apply for a passport without authorisation, as part of sweeping new reforms to liberalise the conservative Islamic kingdom.The new laws, announced on Friday, also give women the right for the first time to register their childrens births, marriage or orce.The royal decrees were published in the kingdoms official weekly Um al-Qura gazette, according to the BBC.The new law is set to go into effect by the end of August, the Saudi embassy in Washington said.A statement from the embassy read: “Under its provisions, women will be able to apply for their passports independently in the same manner that men apply.The rulings also extend to employment regulations which give women the right to work without facing any discrimination based on gender, disability or age.It comes after a series of high profile attempts by Saudi women to escape from the kingdom and seek refuge abroad.Saudi women have remained largely subject to the whims of men due to strict ship laws.The conservative laws bar women from obtaining a passport, travelling abroad or marrying without the consent of a male relative.Women have been required to seek male relatives permission to obtain or renew a passport and exit the country.Women without a passport of their own were instead given a page in their male s passports, making it impossible to travel without male accompaniment.The move represents a signicant opening for women in Saudi Arabia, where womens rights have steadily and slowly gained ground over the years.The change is part of sweeping reforms by the Kings son and de-facto leader Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman.The Crown Prince unveiled a plan in  to transform the economy by , with the aim of increasing womens participation in the workforce to  per cent from  per cent.Last year, he lted a driving ban imposed on women, loosened rules on gender segregation and brought concerts and cinemas to the country.It was a historic moment for women who previously had to rely on their husbands, fathers, brothers and private drivers to run basic errands, get to work, visit friends or even drop kids off at school.Despite the series of changes, many still believe women are treated as second-class citizens under the overwhelmingly conservative regime.Much of Saudi Arabia’s population is deeply traditional and male ship laws remain popular among many who view it as a religious mandate.The conservative Islamic nation ranked  of  countries in the  Global Gender Gap, a World Economic Forum study on how women fare in economic and political participation, health and education.Up until last year, Saudi Arabia was the only country in the world where women werent allowed to drive.The strict rules were enforced despite neither Islamic or Saudi law explicitly prohibiting female drivers.The lting of the ban, which for years drew international condemnation, was welcomed by Western allies as proof of a new progressive trend in Saudi Arabia.However, critics point to the number of harsh restrictions that still remain.Gendered rules continue to be enforced by religious police.Men and women are not allowed to mix at public events.Basic womens entitlements still remain at the whim of male relatives.In order to marry or orce, women still need the permission of a male .This also extends to opening a business, or in some cases even access health care.Legally, women are treated like minors, their testimony is given less weight in court.Recent government crackdowns on activists saw several women detained, including those who had campaigned for the right to drive.Saudi Arabia also retains the death penalty for a large number of offences, including brutal medieval-style executions.Stoning also remains a punishment for adultery for women.In  a married -year-old woman, originally from Sri Lanka, who was working as a maid in Riyadh, was sentenced to death by stoning.Her partner, who was single and also from Sri Lanka, was given a punishment of  lashes after being found guilty of the same offence.A number of high profile cases has exposed the attempts made by some Saudi women to flee the strict regime.Earlier this year, Saudi teenager Rahaf Mohammed al-Qunun, , fled her “abusive” family to seek refuge in Australia and was granted asylum in Canada.She explained: They wont let me drive or travel. I am oppressed. I love le and work and I am very ambitious but my family is preventing me from living.Many Saudi women have celebrated the changes, with some taking to social media.Reema Bandar Al-Saud, Saudi Arabias ambassador to the United States, tweeted that the reforms are a sign of the countrys unequivocal commitment to gender equality.Prominent influencer and talk show host Muna AbuSulayman also tweeted: A generation growing up completely free and equal to their brothers.

title: us inf russia new nuclear arms race
story: This will formally terminate an historic agreement that eliminated more than , missiles stationed around continent and Britain during the stand-off between the West and the Soviet Union. The Intermediate-Range Nuclear Forces Treatywas signed by US President Ronald Reagan and Soviet leader Mikhail Gorbachev in .It banned missiles with ranges between  and , miles.Mid-range nuclear weapons, which are banned under the treaty,  are very hard to detect and could reach European cities within minutes.This gives people little or no time to shelter and for air defences to down the missiles. But earlier this year the US and Nato accused Russia of violating the pact by deploying a new mid-range cruise missile, something which Moscow has denied.Back then Trump had set today as the deadline for the US to withdrawRussia didnt come into compliance.Speaking to the BBC about the collapse of the treaty, Nato Secretary General Jens Stoltenberg said: This is serious.The INF treaty has been a corner stone in arms control for decades.We have to be prepared for a world... with more Russian missiles.Later speaking at a press conference, Mr Stoltenburg vowed Nato would not deploy nuclear missiles in Europe.UN Secretary General Antonio Guterres also warned the INF was “an invaluable brake on nuclear war.He said: This will likely heighten, not reduce, the threat posed by ballistic missiles. Secretary of State Mike Pompeo said: Russias noncompliance under the treaty jeopardises US supreme interests as Russias development and fielding of a treaty-violating missile system represents a direct threat to the United States and our allies and partners.”Senior administration officials, who spoke on condition of anonymity, said Russia had deployed multiple battalions of a Russian cruise missile throughout Russia in violation of the pact.This includes western Russia, with the ability to strike critical European targets.Russia denies the allegation.It says the missiles range puts it outside the treaty and has accused the United States of inventing a  pretext to exit a treaty which it claims Washington wants to leave anyway so it can develop new missiles. Russia has also rejected a US demand to destroy the new missile. The US is to test its own mid-range, land launched Tomahawk cruise missile later this month.The arms race began after the US exploded two nuclear bombs over Japan to end World War Two. But it really got under way when the Soviet Union exploded its first bomb in . Washington then stepped up its development of nukes, exploding a much more powerful “thermonuclear” weapon over the Pacic atoll of Eniwetak in . The Soviets exploded their own version in .By the s each side had enough nukes — and missiles to launch them — to create a sitation chillingly known as Mutually Assured Destruction .Should one side attack, the other would strike back and cause equal destruction. The prospect of this arguably acted as a deterrent throughout the Cold War. Still, the risk to the world was deemed too great. So in  the United States and the Soviet Union signed the first comprehensive nuclear arms reduction treaty.The most signicant agreement, which is widely thought to have ended the Cold War, was the  Intermediate-range Nuclear Forces Treaty .The treaty bans land-based missiles with a range between  and , miles..Essentially this ended the threat of a surprise attack as either side would have little warning. By , nearly , missiles had been scrapped. The two countries were allowed to inspect each others installations.Trump has said he would like to see a next-generation arms control deal with Russia and China to cover all types of nuclear weapons.He broached the topic inidually with Putin and Chinese President Xi Jinping at the G summit in Osaka in June.China is not a party to nuclear arms pacts between the United States and Russia and it is unclear how willing Beijing would be to be drawn into talks.Chinas Foreign Ministry has reiterated that the country had no interest in joining such talks.

title: truth behind the kennedy curse
story: However, it is a clan that was dogged by death long before JFK was infamously gunned down on the streets of Dallas.And  - following the overdose death of Saoirse Kennedy Hill  - the so-called family curse still appears to be casting a very dark shadow.Most people know about the shocking assassinations of President Kennedy and his brother Robert in the s.However, the scandal-hit Kennedys have suffered a string of personal tragedies which some believe is down to more than just bad luck.Now  members of the family and their spouses have died before their time - others outside the family have perished along the way.Intertwined with the shocking death toll, the family has been rocked by rape and murder scandals, claims of drugs abuse and high society marriage break-ups.Cancer has also played a role in the Kennedy family tragedies and in , Ted Kennedys -year-old son Edward Jr. lost a leg to bone cancer.He later told CNN in  he rejected the idea of a family curse.The Kennedy family has had to endure these things in a very open way. But our family is just like ... every other family in America in many ways, he said.However, here are the key dates which some say add weight to the legend of the Kennedy Curse:Joseph Patrick Kennedy Jr was killed in August  during World War II - he was just  years old.He was tragically died when his bomber aircraft exploded over Suffolk during the Second World War.Kennedy had completed  combat missions and was eligible tohome but decided to fight on.Joseph was posthumously awarded the Navy Cross, Air Medal, and Purple Heart Medal for his heroics.He was the eldest of nine children born to Joseph P. Kennedy Sr. and Rose Fitzgerald Kennedy.Kathleen Kennedy died in a plane crash four years after her high-profile wedding to the Marquess of Hartington.While working with the Red Cross, she began a romantic relationship with Lord Hartington, whom she married in May .He was killed on active service in Belgium only four months later.Kathleen, , then died in a plane crash in May , flying to the south of France while on vacation with her new partner, the th Earl Fitzwilliam.On November ,  President John F Kennedy was infamously assassinated as he rode in an open convertible through Dallas, Texas.He was killed just months after his son died just two days after he was born.Of all the events in US history, the death has probably spawned more conspiracy theories than any other.However, the official explanation is that Lee Harvey Oswald was the sole gunmanFormer US Marine Oswald was a proud communist, who briefly defected to the USSR, and was a supporter of Cuban leader Fidel Castro.He was allegedly motivated to kill the President by Kennedy’s hard line approach to Cuba including a botched invasion in  known as the Bay of Pigs.Five years after JFKs death, his younger brother Robert was assassinated after winning the Calornia Democratic primary.One June ,  he was shot and mortally wounded shortly after midnight at the Ambassador Hotel in Los Angeles.The assassin was later named as Palestinian Sirhan Sirhan - who was apprehended immediately after opening fire with a . pistol.When detectives searched his home they found a chilling diary with the words RFK must die written over and over again.The Chappaquiddick incident refers to a bizarre car crash that occurred in Massachusetts on July , .The late-night accident was caused by Senator Ted Kennedys negligence and resulted in the death of his -year-old passenger Mary Jo KopechneAccording to Kennedys testimony, he accidentally drove his car off the one-lane bridge and into the tide-swept Poucha Pond.He swam free, left the scene, and did not report the accident to the police for ten hours Kopechne died inside the fully submerged car.The story became global news and is believed to have influenced Kennedys decision not to campaign for President in  and .David Kennedy was the fourth child of Robert F Kennedy and aged just  when he watched his dad gunned down on live TV.As a child, he was shy, introverted and sensitive, and shared a particularly strong bond with his father.His fathers shocking assassination left a deep emotional scar on young David and he turned to drugs in his early teens.By  he was dead aged  after overdosing on cocaine, Demerol and Mellaril in a Palm Beach hotel room.On New Years Eve , Michael Kennedy, the sixth of RFKs children, was killed in a skiing accident in Colorado.He was playing American football on skis with his pals when he suddenly crashed into a tree in Aspen, Colorado.The -year-old was not wearing a helmet or any other kind of safety equipment, an inquest later revealed.Michael was just five years old when his uncle was assassinated and  when his dad was also shot dead.John F Kennedy Junior, JFKs son, died while flying his light aircraft to the holiday island of Marthas Vineyard.He reportedly became disoriented during the night flight and then crashed into the ocean on July , .He was travelling with his we Carolyn and sister-in-law Lauren Bessette orce two years earlier.The two had married in  and had four children together. title: santo domingo de guzman festival in nicaragua
story: Other demons are painted red as hundreds invade the Nicaraguan capital each August as the annual Santo Domingo festival explodes in the streets of Managua.Horse parades and bullfights are organised for the festival celebrating the popular saint.The  days of festivities have their roots in the  discovery of the -inch statue of Santo Domingo de Guzman — who is also known as St. Dominic de Guzman, the founder of the Dominican religious order.Legend has it that a peasant named Vicente Aburto was cutting down a tree, in what was then the outskirts of Managua, when he found the tiny rendering of the saint.The statue the faithful refer to as Papito which translates as Daddy.It is protected by a glass bell and carried through throngs of people in the street during the celebration.In Central America the black devil, or El Cadejo, is an evil dog-like spirit with glowing red eyes that locals believe eats new born puppies.The creature is said to to be able to stand on two feet like a human and throw punches at its victims.

title: mh370 mystery u turn vanishing aviation expert
story: Veteran pilot Sylvia Wrigley told The Sun Online that she believes the key to unravelling the mystery lies behind the planes first turn.The aviation author described the infamous U-turn as extremely interesting.She said: The aircraft turned after it disappeared from secondary radar, the point at which the transponder was either turned off or failed.We only know what happened because it was tracked on military radar.As a part of the investigation into the flights doomed fate, the Malaysian government recreated the mystery turn.The simulations determined the point where the aircraft entered and exited the turn.Ms Wrigley says the simulations prove that the turn was at a steep bank anglewhile travelling at  knots.She adds that such a turn is simply not possible using the autopilot.The simulation results tell us one very important thing: the aircraft was under manual control.This was not a pre-programmed route and the autopilot was disengaged.It would not be easy to fly a controlled turn at that angle, which tells us that the person in control of the aircraft was experienced.Ms Wrigleys analysis backs up the claims that Malaysian captain and veteran pilot Zaharie Amad Shah was flying the aircraft when it disappeared.In the wake of the planes disappearance, rumours surfaced that he had locked the co-pilot out of the cockpit then crashed the plane in a murder-suicide.Ms Wrigley believes that after the initial sharp turn, the aircraft followed a set of waypoints.It is likely that on-board navigation systems were in use and so its impossible to knowsomeone was in the cockpit and how alert they were, she adds.However, she notes that the Malaysian investigation shows clearly that an experienced pilot was at the controls for the turn erting the aircraft back towards Malaysia.Ms Wrigley is the author of Without a Trace — a two-volume work covering aviation mysteries from  to the present day.Passengers included Chinese calligraphers, a couple on their way home to their young sons after a long-delayed honeymoon and a construction worker who hadnt been home in a year.But at .am on March , , Malaysia Airlines lost contact with MH close to Phuket island in the Strait of Malacca.Before that, Malaysian authorities believe the last words heard from the plane, from either the pilot or co-pilot, was Good night Malaysian three seven zero.Satellite pings from the aircraft suggest it continued flying for around seven hours when the fuel would have run out.Experts have calculated the most likely crash site around , miles west of Perth, Australia.But a huge search of the seabed failed to find any wreckage - and there are a number of alternative theories as to its fate. Five pieces, thought to be from the plane, recently washed up in Madagascar.Aviation expert Victor Iannello believes one fragment, which appears to be from the interior floorboard, is consistent with a “high-speed impact.More than  bits of aircraft debris have been collected from ious places around the world but only three wing fragments that washed up along the Indian Ocean have been confirmed to be from MH.In October , a sleuth claimed hed spotted an engine in the Cambodian jungle.Daniel Boyer previously claimed to have found the cockpit and tail, complete with Malaysia Airlines logo, of the missing aircraft.Some feared Russian president Vladimir Putin was involved in the hijacking of MH.US Science writer Jeff Wise claimed Putin spoofed the planes navigation data so it could fly unnoticed into Baikonur Cosmodrome so he could hurt the West.French ex-airline director Marc Dugain accused the US military of shooting down the plane because they feared it had been hijacked.Malaysia police chief Tan Sri Khalid Abu Bakar suggested the disappearance could have been the result of a suicide.He claimed someone on board could have taken out a large le insurance package before getting on the plane, so they could treat their family or pay back the money they owed.Historian and writer Norman Davies suggested MH could have been remotely hacked and flown to a secret location as a result of sensitive material being carried aboard the jet.Malaysia Airlines found a -inch crack in the fuselage of one of its planes, days before MH disappeared.The Federal Aviation Administration insists it issued a final warning two days before the disappearance.But the Daily Mirror claimed the missing jet did not have the same antenna as the rest of the Boeing s so it did not receive the warning.Prime Minister Malcolm Turnbull unexpectedly said it was “very likely that the captain planned this shocking event”.He claimed the pilot wanted to create the worlds greatest mystery.Another theory claimed that he hijacked his own plane in protest of the jailing of then-Malaysian opposition leader Anwar Ibrahim, and as a way to destabilise the corrupt government of Najib Razak.Another seemingly far-fetched idea said the pilot had deliberately crashed the plane to cover his track as he had parachuted out of the plane so he could spend the rest of his le with his girlfriend who was waiting in a boat in the sea.In the wake of the incident, South Korea noted that North Korea nearly took out a Chinese plane which had  passengers on board, on March , .Some fear Pyongyang shot the plane down, but others believe it was hijacked and erted into the communist nation.One theory claims that because many relatives were able to hear a ringing tone for up to four days after the crash so the doomed jet could not have smashed into the Indian Ocean.Nineteen families have all claimed the devices of their loved ones rang for up to four days after the jet went missing.However, wireless analysts claim that phone firms sometimes use a phantom ringing sound when the device is not active, the Daily Star reports.In September , British video producer Ian Wilson claimed to have found the missing aircraft using Google Maps.Despite millions being spent on the search to located the wreckage, the Brit sleuth believes he has found the jet in a mountainous area of the Cambodian jungle.In response, the Chinese government used observation company Space View to focus in on the high-altitude area on the outskirts of Phnom Penh.However, the firm claim there was no sign of any plane, least of all the Malaysian Airlines aircraft which has been missing since March .An MH sleuth has claimed that locals in Cambodia told him they saw a plane believed to be the doomed Malaysia Airlines flight crashing in the jungle.If the jet was flying north then possible locations could stretch as fast as the border between Kazakhstan and Turkmenistan to Thailand.The Malaysian Prime Minister Najib Razak originally asked the Kazakhstan leader Nursultan Nazarbayev to set up a search operation in the country but this quickly got sidelined as the rescue efforts focused on the Indian Ocean.

title: botox stop men premature ejaculation
story: Researchers found the muscle-relaxing jabs helped rats last almost four-times longer on average.And they believe the treatment will work just as well in fellas who struggle to control their excitement.Premature ejaculation affects  per cent of men and is the most common sexual dys in young lads.Turkish scientists tested the power of Botox jabs – typically used to ease facial wrinkles – in  male rodents.Some received a single dose of the toxin injected into a muscle near their privates and some received five doses.A final control group was not injected.The boffins, from Balikesir University, then stimulated the rats and timed how long it took them to peak.Those given a single dose lasted .-times longer than the untreated group. And those given five doses lasted .-times longer.Study leader Dr Sakir Ongun said the effects of Botox can last up to nine months in humans.He added: “Injection of botulinum-A toxin into the bulbospongiosus muscle in rats signicantly delayed the ejaculation latency time.“We suggest that botulinum-A toxin should be considered in the treatment of premature ejaculation.“Although premature ejaculation is a common disease, treatment options remain limited.”Sex therapists say romps that last three to seven minutes are “adequate” and seven to thirteen minutes “desirable”.Anything shorter or longer may disappoint, a poll found.The research findings are published in the Journal of Sexual Medicine. Our journalists strive for accuracy but on occasion we make mistakes. story: Leanne, Louise and Samantha Whelan launched the foul-mouthed assault on Peter Taylor, a family friend, during a furious and bitter feud in Wirral, Merseyside.The three single mums walked free from Liverpool Crown Court on Wednesday after Judge Gary Woodhall said jail would cause signicant harm to their children.Today, the sisters insist they arent scumbags and they are also victims of the ugly dispute.Pregnant Leanne, , swung a hammer at Mr Taylor and missed his upper body before her sisters Louise, , and Samantha, , joined in launching homophobic abuse at him.The sisters claimed to have alibis before admitting threatening behaviour ahead of a trial.They pleaded guilty to the lesser charge of threatening behaviour and Leanne admitted she possessed the hammer.The trio where seen laughing outside court on Wednesday and have said theyve also received abuse.Louise told the Liverpool Echo: Were now on gay pride websites for being homophobic.We never laughed leaving court we laughed on our dinner break. Were allowed to laugh.Lousie also said they were approached about being on a TV documentary by a man and they laughed at him - not being spared jail.She further claimed Leanne only raised the hammer to scare Mr Taylor.Prosecutors said there was a dispute over a dog between the sisters and the paternal grandmother of Samanthas children, Deborah McKenna.They said Ms McKenna and her son Thomas Carson reported their concerns about the welfare of the children to social services, but no action was taken.Paul Becker, prosecuting, said the dispute later involved Katie Cunningham, Mr Carsons girlfriend, and Mr Taylor.He added all parties on both sides were warned about their behaviour by a housing association last August.The wicked sisters said they were driving to their mums when they saw Ms Cunningham outside Mr Taylors house.Prosecutors accept it was a chance encounter, but the trio got out of a silver Mercedes and were heard shouting come on lets go.Ms Cunningham fled into the house and Mr Taylor came from the back garden to investigate what the shouting was about.Mr Becker said the sisters were shouting at Ms Cunningham and Ms McKenna to come out of the house, but Mr Taylor stepped in and told them to calm down.He said: Samantha Whelan was abusive and said f*** off, we dont want you.In what was described as chaotic scenes, Leanne tried to swing the hammer at Mr Taylor as he stood his ground.Mr Becker said: Leanne Whelan was seen to be bouncing towards Mr Taylor, threatening and generally acting aggressively. Mr Taylor was shocked and scared.He added Mr Taylor backed off and the sisters walked away while all shouting homophobic comments about Mr Taylor.Judge Woodhall handed Leanne was nine months in jail, and Louise and Samantha nine weeks in jail, all suspended for  months.The judge further handed all three sisters three-month home curfews, from pm to am daily, plus -day Rehabilitation Activity Requirements.A five-year restraining order was also imposed to protect Mr Taylor and Ms McKenna.Leannes past convictions a, while Samantha has assaulted a police officer, committed battery and shoplted.Leanne has five previous convictions for  offences, including assaulting a police officer and assault causing actual bodily harm.Samantha has three previous convictions for assaulting a police officer, battery and shoplting.Louise has  previous convictions for  offences, including racially aggravated harassment against a supermarket security guard and shoplting.

title: thai king mistress royal consort
story: King Maha Vajiralangkornm, , used ceremonial water to anoint his long-term girlfriend Sineenat Wongvajirapakdi, , while she lay at his feet on Sunday.This is the first time in the countrys modern history that a monarch has publicly admitted to having more than one partner.Sineenat, who is the King’s former bodyguard, was given the title of chao khun phra meaning royal noble consort during the ceremony which marked his birthday.His new we Queen Suthida, who was sat next to her husband during the televised service, showed no emotion as Vajiralongkorn splashed water on his fancy woman.The mistress lay on the floor at her lover’s feet during the ceremony, in accordance with Thailand’s royal tradition.This is the first time a Thai king has practised polygamy since the end of the absolute monarchy in .Sineenat also received four medals, including the most noble order of the crown of Thailand and the most exalted order of the white elephant, special class.Vajiralongkorn also praised her work as senior officer in his personal bodyguard, the Ratchawallop Police Retainers.Sineenat, known as Koi, also holds the rank of major-general and was born Niramon Ounprom.She formerly worked as a nurse at the Ananda Mahidol army hospital.Her elevation comes less than three months after the monarch’s marriage to former Thai Airways stewardess Suthida, , known as Nui, who had been his consort for some years.In May, official photos showed Queen Suthida laying on the floor as she was given a gt by the king during her wedding ceremony to the monarch.The surprise announcement was carried in the Royal Gazette and footage from Wednesdays wedding ceremony was later shown on the nightly Royal News segment aired on all Thai television channels.Vajiralongkorn, , also known by the title King Rama X, became constitutional monarch after the death of his revered father, King Bhumibol Adulyadej, in October , after  years on the throne.He is due to be officially crowned in elaborate Buddhist and Brahmin ceremonies on Saturday, followed by a procession through Bangkok the next day.In , Vajiralongkorn appointed Suthida Tidjai, a former flight attendant for Thai Airways, as a deputy commander of his bodyguard unit.Some royal observers and foreign media had linked Suthida romantically with the king, but the palace had previously never acknowledged a relationship between them.The king made Suthida a full general in the Royal Thai Army in December , and the deputy commander of the kings personal guard in . He also made her a Thanpuying, a royal title meaning Lady during the lavish ceremony.However, the kings pristine ceremonial outfit was a far cry from the outrageous croptop and low-slung jeans he was once spotted wearing while wandering around a German shopping centre.The monarch even threatened to sue Facebook over the startling shots, taken in  by a passer-by who recognised the king.The images, which appeared to show Maha out for a stroll with a girlfriend while wearing fake tattoo “sleeves”, fall foul of Thailand’s extremely strict law of “lese-majeste” — or insulting royalty.But the king’s bizarre dress sense is just the tip of the iceberg for this clearly very dferent monarch.Indeed, his string of failed marriages and apparently insatiable appetite for women - his own mother Queen Sirikit branded him a womaniser - has had Thais quietly gossiping for years.During a  trip to the US, Sirikit said: “My son, the Crown Prince, is a little bit of a Don Juan.He is a good student, a good boy, but women find him interesting and he finds women even more interesting.”Maha has ruled Thailand since the death last year of his father who was married to Sirikit for  of those years.But in stark contrast to his father, Brit-educated Maha has already orced three times - and is now on his FOURTH we.In  he married his first we — his cousin, Princess Soamsawali Kitiyakara.They had a daughter, Bajrakitiyabha, but the relationship was doomed from the start.During the marriage Maha fathered four sons and a daughter with his mistress, actress Yuvadhida Polpraserth.They began living together but his we refused to orce him.Finally, in , he sued for orce, laying the blame for the failed relationship entirely at Soamsawali’s feet.He married Yuvadhida the following year but after a mysterious bust-up two years later, she fled to the UK to escape her husband.Livid Maha ordered posters to be placed all around his palace accusing her of adultery with a -year-old Thai air marshal.The prince then had his daughter brought back to Thailand. His four sons say they were banned from ing by their father.In a letter written in  they said: “We were ordered by our father not tohome to Thailand. We were afraid to risk even demonstrating the slightest inference of disrespect toward the Royal Family.”In  the king married his third we — former waitress Srirasmi Suwadee, who had been in his service since .He kept the marriage secret from the public until , when she gave birth to their son, Prince Dipangkorn Rasmijoti.Maha even told a magazine it was his intention to settle down.The pair bought a poodle, Foo Foo, which Maha became devoted to in a way that even the most ardent dog lover would find extreme.He made it an Air Chief Marshal in the Royal Thai Air Force and the dog appeared at official s dressed in a dinner jacket.In  Foo Foo was a guest at a reception held by the US Ambassador Ralph Boyce.In a leaked document, Mr Boyce said: “Foo Foo was present at the event, dressed in formal evening attire complete with paw mitts.“At one point during the band’s second number, he jumped up on to the head table and began lapping from the guests’ water glasses, including my own.“The Air Chief Marshal’s antics drew the full attention of the -plus audience members, and remains the talk of the town to this day.”Foo Foo hit the headlines once again when a video from its birthday party surfaced online.It appears to show topless Srirasmi lying on the floor in just a G-string, feeding cake to the dog.She sings Happy Birthday to it before getting on her hands and knees and eating from the same bowl as Foo Foo.When the dog died in  Maha gave it a four-day funeral complete with Buddhist rites before it was cremated in a lavish ceremony.A year earlier he orced Srirasmi, stripped her royal titles and exiled her to an undisclosed location in Thailand — with a reported settlement of £.m.He then jailed her parents for two-and-a-half years for “royal defamation”. Soon afterwards he hooked-up with his latest we Vajiralongkorn - who is nicknamed Nui.Among the dignitaries at their wedding were Prayuth Chan-ocha, the leader of the military junta that has run Thailand since a  army coup.

title: jane dodds liberal democrat brecon constituency
story: The newly-elected MP has reduced the Torys majority in parliament to just one. Heres what we know about her.The -year-old was born and brought up in Wrexham, North Wales, and can speak Welsh.She trained to be a social worker having graduated from Cardf University.Ms Dodds previously worked for the Salvation Army in Child Protective Services as well as on a number of local councils.She also worked in the Children’s Section of the Refugee Council.Her political career started in  when she was elected as one of three councillors in the North Richmond ward of Richmond upon Thames in London but lost her seat in .She then stood in  and  for the Liberal Democrats in the seat of Montgomeryshire which had been held by the party from  to .Ms Dodds also contested the corresponding Welsh Assembly constituency of Montgomeryshire in .On each occasion she came second behind the Welsh Conservative candidate.Now she has been elected as the MP for Brecon and Radnorshire, after a by-election took place on August , .The by-election battle in South Wales has received a large amount of media scrutiny because Ms Dodds win reduced the Conservative Party majority to just one.Prime Minister Boris Johnson’s plans for the country as well as Brexit are becoming increasingly dficult to achieve.Mr Johnson even visited the constituency on July  in a bid to bolster support for the Conservatives and their candidate, the current MP Chris Davies.The by-election was held after Mr Davies was convicted of filing  expenses and , voters signed a petition to recall him.There was shock from many voters when the Conservatives then stood by Mr Davies and selected him as their candidate for the seat.Ms Dodds won the vote with . per cent, compared to Davies  per cent.In the EU referendum though  per cent of the constituency voted to leave at odds with the Lib Dem policy of wanting to stay in the bloc.A  per cent swing saw Jane Dodds romp to victory in the Welsh seat - shocking the Tories who now have a perilously weak grip on power.She secured . per cent of the vote in Brecon and Radnorshire - ahead of disgraced Tory MP Chris Davies on . per cent.After topping the poll by , votes, Ms Dodds said: The people of this constituency have chosen hope over fear. We demand better.And encapsulating the threat to Brexit her victory poses, Ms Dodds added that her first act as an MP will be to demand a No Deal exit is ruled out.She said: People are desperately crying out for a dferent kind of politics.There is no time for tribalism when our country is faced with a Boris Johnson government and the threat of a No Deal Brexit.So my very first act as your MP when I arrive in Westminster will be to find Mr Boris Johnson wherever he is hiding and tell him loud and clear: Stop playing with the future of our communities and rule out a No Deal Brexit now.With the DUPs votes counted, the PM now has the support of  MPs - while opposition parties have .It was also a humiliating defeat for Labour - who narrowly avoided losing their deposit.Candidate Tom Davies limped behind in a dismal fourth place with just . per cent - beating only the Monster Raving Loony Party and Ukip.Support for Jeremy Corbyns party collapsed by . per cent - with Labour voters swarming to the Lib Dems and Brexit Party, who came third.Ukip were pummelled into last place with just  votes - even losing out to the fth-placed Monster Raving Loony Party.Turnout was at . per cent - the highest for a by-election in  years since Winchester in November .Ms Dodds told Thepeople wanted a “fresh approach to politics”.She said: “People are looking for something a bit dferent.“They want change in the way politics is done.They want change in the way how we look at the big picture issues and we want a more adult approach.”She is strongly opposed to a No Deal Brexit.Ms Dodds said: “The first thing that I’m clear about is that a No Deal Brexit must be taken off the table.“But beyond that, people do know what the Lib Dem position is, though – we aren’t dishonest about that – and they know we are a remain party who will campaign for a ‘people’s vote’.”She told the I newspaper: “The Liberal Democrats, since the referendum result in , have always been the Remain party.And even before that, were the international pro European party. So we absolutely are very clear and very honest about that.“We are the party also that says we should have a People’s Vote.“And I think that actually appeals to people. Becausethey are thinking: ‘Well, you know, I may have changed my mind one way or the other then I’ve got an opportunity to reflect on the last three years and say how, either, I want to leave the EU or Remain’.”Ms Dodds has also made a point of highlighting local issues as part of her campaign.She said: “We’ve had three years – how much longer are we going to have Brexit  [The constituents] want things to happen.“They want things to change. They want better broadband, they want banks, we all want better post offices and better high streets with no empty shops.”Our journalists strive for accuracy but on occasion we make mistakes. title: how council housings century long
story: NewsHow council housings century-long proud history shames our modern timesThe Addison Act of  changed British society for the better - but its legacy has been tarnished by future governments, explains Brian Reade.ShareCommentsByBrian Reade:,  AUG NewsCouncil houses stretch along the landscape in Great Yarmouth, "Get the biggest daily news stories by emailSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailFor generations of working-class families being handed the keys to a council house felt like grasping the Holy Grail. Moving out of insecure and often squalid properties into somewhere safe, clean, with spacious rooms and a garden, hot running water and inside bathrooms was a palatial upgrade. For people unable to buy a house it gave pride, dignity, independence and hope. But mostly a home in the heart of a community and the possibility of ­security for le. A century ago this week, a Liberal government passed The Addison Act, forcing every local authority to build council housing. It was part of David Lloyd George’s Homes Fit For Heroes campaign sparked by concerns over the shocking physical condition of many First World War army recruits. But actually it was  years earlier, in , that the first council houses in Europe were built, tenement blocks called St Martin’s Cottages in the ­Scotland Road area of Liverpool. As in  necessity was the mother of invention, when appalled health officials looked at the inhumane living conditions of a working-class dockside population which had exploded due to the booming port and large-scale Irish immigration and realised they must act.    The  flats and maisonettes, which cost s d a week to rent, were refurbished many times before demolition in . All that remains is a commemorative plaque outside a social club opposite where St Martin’s stood. Marie Maloney, , who lived in the tenements as a small child in the early s, before her large family moved out to Croxteth, has typically fond memories: “It was a very special place to the people who lived there. Everyone looked after each other. If we were ever short of money there was always someone to give you a shilling for the gas.” The community became the extended family’s spiritual home, so much that her elder brothers would often walk the six miles back to Scotland Road to where they felt comfortable. The golden age of council house-building came after the Second World War, when Clement Attlee’s Labour government built more than ,, largely to replace those flattened by Hitler’s Luftwaffe.    They were a new generation of council houses, built to more generous specications, with subsidies given to keep down rents. It meant decent, affordable housing was finally available to most low-income families. And today it raises a question: If a nation virtually bankrupted by war could do that while at the same time nationalising key industries, creating a welfare state and building a National Health Service, how come, today, the world’s fth richest country offers no solutions to a similar housing crisis  The UK currently has more than a million people on housing waiting lists, with , children in temporary shelter. The state of some of that temporary housing is heartbreaking: squalid, insect-infested BBs and container-like shells which resemble prison cells.    Rough sleeping has doubled since , home-ownership has fallen to a -year low with the average house costing eight times the average annual salary, and almost double that in London. Housing charity Shelter estimates there is a social housing deficit of . million homes. Meanwhile luxury flats stand empty and millions are paying exorbitant rent to private landlords. Yet the obvious solution we came up with in  is nowhere to be seen. In  there were . million council houses, today it is two million and shrinking. In the s we were building , a year,  times more than the , we build today.    George Clarke, an architect presenting a Channel  series to commemorate the centenary of the Addison Act, wants the Government to build , new council homes a year and suspend Right To Buy, because “everyone should have the option of a decent quality home to rent. If people are in stable homes with affordable rents then everything has a chance of falling into place.” His point being thatyou don’t give the poorest families the chance to achieve dignity you end up with acute homelessness, crime, social and mental health issues. The problem is that ever since Margaret Thatcher came to power, council house ownership has been a dirty notion.    She saw the state as the enemy so gave every tenant who had lived in their council house for three years the right to buy it.More than two million did but a fraction of the money went to councils who were barred from spending all but a small amount of it on new housing stock. Worse,  per cent of the council houses that were bought were sold on to private landlords. Hence a ticking time-bomb ignored by Governments including Tony Blair ’s Labour, who didn’t want to appear “unaspirational” by building council houses.Nick Clegg recalls raising the issue with the Lib Dem coalition cabinet, and being told by a prominent Tory: “I don’t understand why you keep going on about more social housing – it just creates Labour voters.”    Since the Great Thatcher Sell-off a stigma has been attached to council housing which has held back progressive thinking. Many on the right demonise estates as a collection of Benefits Streets occupied by the undeserving poor. Which suits their agenda of dismantling the state and delivering all assets into private hands. It’s why today we have effectively privatised housing the way we did water, gas and railways. The truth is that not everyone can afford to buy a house but everyone needs a home. And it is possible toto that Attlee ideal of building council houses better than ever.  Labour realises this, and has pledged to build, over  years, a million affordable homes to rent and buy, including the biggest council house-building programme for almost four decades. It will also stop the sell-off of , social rented homes a year by suspending the Right To Buy.If we can find billions for a no-deal Brexit that probably won’t happen, why can’t we find it to fix a housing crisis that is very much happening If the Old Etonians who run the country truly believe an Englishman’s home is his castle why are they happy to let so many stare forlornly at a pulled-up drawbridge

story: NewsopinionPaul Routledge: Turn off the hot air and go frack for gas, JeremyJeremy Corbyn ­promises a ban on fracking for gasLabour wins power – there are votes here, but it’s a short-sighted, blinkered policy that would make the UK dependent on insecure importsShareByPaul Routledge:,  AUG Updated:,  AUG NewsopinionJeremys making promises on fracking "Get the biggest politics stories by emailSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailHarry and Meghan will help save the planet by having only two children, for which the globe and taxpayer are duly grateful. story: NewsCambridge students final mumbled message to mum before jumping to death from planeAlana Cutland sounded upset in a phone call to her mum before she plunged to death from a plane in Madagascar, it is claimedShareCommentsByChris Kitching:,  AUG Updated:,  AUG NewsAlana Cutland, , was researching the endangered blue crab in Madagascar "Get the biggest daily news stories by emailSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailA Cambridge student who plunged from a plane in Madagascar was mumbling and incoherent in the days before her death, her uncle says. Her family believe she was hallucinating on prescription drugs and didnapost intend to kill herself when she opened the planeaposs door and jumped out, it was reported. The -year-oldaposs body has not been found after she plunged up to ,ft into the savanna on the Indian Ocean island, where she was researching the endangered blue crab. Have you been affected by this story  Email webnews@mirror    She had taken ill after being there for a few days and when she spoke to her mother on the phone two days before the accident she was mumbling and sounded pretty incoherent, Lester Riley, the brother of Ms Cutlandaposs mother Alison, told MailOnline. The Biological Natural Sciences student, from Milton Keynes, Buckinghamshire, was due to spend six weeks in Madagascar, where she was carrying out research in the remote area of Anjajavy. Police believe Ms Cutland landed in an area populated by carnivorous fossas, cat-like mammals endemic to Madagascar. title: what its really like being
story: NewsThis is what its really like being in the crowd at a ,-person Trump rallyMirror’s man in US enters fray at Trump rally to see why supporters love himShareCommentsByChristopher Bucktin:,  AUG NewsPresident Donald Trump speaks at a campaign rally in Cincinnati, Ohio "Get the biggest daily news stories by emailSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailStanding among the crowd wearing Make America Great Again caps and T-shirts while some of them screamed “Shove gun control up your a**” and “Trump Rambo”, I was nervous. Typically I’d cover Donald Trump’s rallies from either behind the penned barricades or from the safety of a live feed off a TV news channel. But this time it was dferent. For, after braving five hours waiting to board the Trump Train at the President’s latest  re-election rally, I joined thousands of his supporters in Cincinnati’s C heat to become just another face in the crowd. Like the President, I was more interested in how his base responded, and to what, opting this time to just listen to what they were saying to each other, and to Trump, instead of fact-checking his every word.  The President wasn’t scheduled to take to the stage until pm but by .pm, after being patted down by the Secret Service, I’d taken my seat stage right. Sitting alongside the Deplorables, as Hillary Clinton labelled Trump’s supporters, I was told by farmer and uber Trump fan Nick Pepper to expect “fireworks”. “This will be like nothing you’ve ever seen before,” the three-time rally veteran told me. “He’s our leader and we believe in what he says. “If President Trump says we need a wall, we need a wall. “If he says send those who don’t like our country home, send them home. “He delivers on his promises.” As , filled the US Bank Arena, the die-hard crowd were played like a symphony orchestra as Team Trump whipped supporters into a frenzy as they waited for their messiah. One-by-one, local politicians and judges – yes, they are political here – took to the stage to tell why the President should be re-elected on November  next year, only then for the real warm-up act to enter. Grinning inanely like a constipated Cheshire Cat, Don Trump Jr, swaggered his way to the podium. Having torn himself away from the killing fields and put down his big-game hunting rles, the President’s eldest child picked up his political pistols to fire off volley after volley of attacks on his father’s critics. Whether it be Trump’s political opponents, cities which his dad had attacked, immigration or mocking Joe Biden, nothing was off-limits. Then, after what seemed like the entire Rolling Stones back catalogue, Survivor’s Eye of the Tiger kicked in and the crowd knew the king of bungle was due on stage. He swaggered on like a power-hungry Roman emperor, giving the same thumbs-up Caesar gave in his adoring amphitheatres. As he paced the walkway and smiled and waved, the crowd leapt to its feet and roared, waving campaign-provided signs reading, “Jobs Jobs Jobs” and “Women for Trump”. But it didn’t take long before the President was throwing political red meat to the baying crowd who applauded his every sentence, boast and lie. They reached their thunderous loudest quickly, however, when several protesters showed their hand. In unison, like a military-run pack of hyenas, the crowd turned on them as they held up posters reading, “Immigrants Built America”. The protesters’ cries that Trump was a racist were drowned by chants of “USA, USA,” and “Trump, Trump, Trump,” before the President told “law enforcement” to move in. Quickly, the US leader got back on message. He mocked rival Democrats for attacking former President Barack Obama during a debate this week and got in hits at rivals Joe Biden and Elizabeth Warren during his remarks. But it was the behaviour of the crowd that I and the world were watching, following last month’s rally in North Carolina. There, Trump had continued his racist broadside at a foursome of Democratic congresswomen of colour known as The Squad, telling them to “go back” to the countries they came from – even though three of them were born in the States. Trump supporters at that rally increased the attack with chants of “send her back”. This time, Cincinnati’s crowd offered their fair share of boos, cheers of “USA”, “build the wall,” and even ed to the  campaign chant regarding Hillary Clinton, screaming “lock her up”. But they didn’t go as far as the Carolina supporters, as Trump told the arena: “We want no controversy”. He did, however, blame “the far-left’s destructive agenda” for poverty and crime in inner cities, increasing his effort to tie Democrats to poor neighbourhoods. Trump accused his rivals of prioritising undocumented immigrants over American citizens, called Calornia “a disgrace to our country” and sought to talk up his efforts to improve minority communities. “For decades, these communities have been run exclusively byDemocrat politicians and it’s been total one-party control of the inner cities,” he said. “For  years it’s been one-party control and look at them. We can name one after another but I won’t do that because I don’t want to be controversial.” Trump’s remarks were a clear reference to his recent attacks on Elijah Cummings, the black Democratic lawmaker whose Baltimore district Trump described as “rat and rodent-infested” and a place where “no human being would want to live”.  Trump belittled the Maryland city, a majority-black borough, claiming its murder rate is higher than war-torn Afghanistan. Tellingly, the vast majority in the arena were white – I counted no more than  African Americans. For an hour and  minutes, Trump rambled along, at times incoherently ignoring the autocue, but he knows how to sell himself to his crowd.  His repealing of the Iran nuclear deal, his scuttling of the Paris accords and the moving of the US embassy to Jerusalem, he insisted, had “restored American pride”. “Keep America great again,” he boomed, as he closed his show. The salesman in Trump had sold Cincinnati precisely what they wanted to hear.

This would be the first dedicated spa of its kind in the UK, but the concept has come under fire from some medical professionals.   Speaking to Refinery, Barshop, , explained that the salon will specialise in womenaposs intimate health and help treat the changes that women go through.She adds that the new business, which could open near Harrods in Knightsbridge as early as October, will feature around  percent of the treatments currently offered in the US.These include three dferent types of vaginal tightening, or V-Tightening as they call it, for women who feel loose, as well as a K gold bikini wax and vaginal steaming which sees steam infused with therapeutic herbs targeted toward your nether regions.The cost of these treatments will also be the same as in the states, but youaposll have to enquire with staff to find out exact prices, as the figures are kept under wraps.    Barshop employs a team of doctors to carry out her treatments and believes that as long as they are conducted by gynaecologists, theyaposre safe for women - but not everyone agrees.Dr Vanessa Mackay, a spokesperson for the Royal College of Obstetricians and Gynaecologists , told MailOnline that treatments such as vaginal steaming could be bad for vaginal health, possibly leading to infections such as thrush.She said: The vagina contains good bacteria, which are there to protect it. Similarly, Dr Naomi Crouch of the RCOG pointed out that there was no proven evidence to suggest that techniques such as the O-Shot improve chances of sexual satisfacition. story: Young entrepreneurs set up shop at a former north-east railway line to raise cash in memory of their neighbour.Dylan, , and Iona Hamilton, , along with their friends Daniel, , and Sasha Fox, , set up their food and drink stand on the old Deeside railway line.The four friends, who live in Cults, wanted to raise money for Friends of Anchor in memory of their neighbour Lisa Stratford, who died from cancer last year aged .More than £ was raised by the youngsters through their pop-up shop on the old railway line near their home.Lisa and her husband Phil had created a recipe book with the family’s favourite meals and home bakes.The children made lemon cakes from the book, Mum’s Memorable Recipes, with people able to purchase the sweet treats.Dylan said: “In Cornwall I saw a little shop selling milk and vegetables it had a barrel to put your money in.“That’s where I got the idea to set up a little shop at my house.“Our next door neighbour’s we died of cancer and we wanted to make sure that doesn’t happen to other families.”The youngsters were at the old railway line for around six hours selling their cakes and drinks.Daniel said: “We wanted to raise some money so scientists can find a cure for cancer.“We had good fun selling the cakes and lemonade on the Deeside railway line. It took us all day to sell everything we are very proud of ourselves.”Erica Banks, fundraising executive at Friends of Anchor, said: “Ever since Phil and his family decided to sell Mum’s Memorable Recipes to raise funds for Friends of Anchor, we have been overwhelmed by the support people have shown.“The book itself is such a touching memento for the Stratford family, and it’s a very personal one too.“Food was a huge part of the family’s le and throughout the pages there are handwritten notes, photos and memories.“Lisa’s love of food is clearly making its way into many homes – including Dylan and Iona’s and Daniel and Sasha’s. It was heart-warming to see them whip up their own batch of cakes to sell to passers-by.“We were very impressed by their entrepreneurial spirit, but even more so by their passion to get involved in fundraising.“They have helped to push the total raised so far to more than £,.”

title: coastguard releases audio from north east 999 call for water safety campaign
story: A  call asking for the Coastguard#s help at an incident in the north-east has been released in a bid to boost awareness.The audio relates to an incident which happened at Fraserburgh Beach on July  .In it a woman is heard making the  call as two people were being swept out to sea.The operator checked the exact location before passing the details on to the RNLI and Coastguard rescue team.A message from the helicopter team confirms #all persons are now accounted for#.The full audio has been shared as part of a video to help encourage people to be safe around water.A statement on HM Coastguard # Buchan#s Facebook page said: #The beaches round our coastline are beautul but the unpredictably of the water can catch people out.#Be aware of changing conditions and don#t go out of your depth.#Rememberyou see someone in dficulty at the beach or on the coast dial  and ask for the Coastguard.#The recording closely mirrors a call received by emergency services in the town last week.Drama as hero saves two boys from drowning off north-east coast" src"https:www.eveningexpress fp news local drama-as-hero-saves-two-boys-from-drowning-off-north-east-coast embed # secretktxwEbenVG" data-secret"ktxwEbenVG" width"" "" frameborder"" marginwidth"" margin"" scrolling"no"Fraserburgh Coastguard Rescue Team and the town#s RNLI crew were called, but ultimately not needed, after a fisherman rushed into the sea to rescue two boys.Other Good Samaritans on the beach were onshore to help the pair, which the RNLI described as a #very close thing#.

title: letters week 24
story: Laura MaxwellUpdated:   , : amLikeGoogle +TweetEmailWant to  We value our content, so access to our full site is  only available on subscription.Your subscription entitles you to -day-a-week access to our website, plus a full digital copy of that week#s paper to read on your pc mac or mobile device.And there#s more # your subscription includes access to digital archive copies from  onwardsSir,Further to your article #Three amigos clean up in Lochgilphead#, Friday May , I would like to add the lane behind Lochgilphead Bowling Club is often filled with fresh poo.I#m sick of coming over nearly every day and finding poo all over the lane. The lane floods, so between trying to dodge puddles, you land in dog dirt.I wish they would fix the path because a lot of people use it, some of them pensioners with or parents with prams.Celia MacFarlane, Lochgilphead.Sir,Seven out of ten people with diabetes feel overwhelmed by the demands of their condition and this signicantly affects their mental and physical health.That is why we are calling for new national standards for diabetes emotional and mental health support and to increase support available in Argyll to people living with diabetes.As part of Diabetes UK’s Diabetes Weekwe are urging people in Argyll to #SeeDiabetesDferently and back our campaign for national standards for diabetes mental health support and services.Our recently published research revealed the relentless nature of diabetes can impact people’s emotional well-being and mental health, ranging from day-to-day frustration and low mood, to specic psychological and mental health dficulties including clinical depression and anxiety.The findings, published in the report #Too often missing: Making emotional and psychological support routine in diabetes care#, show that diabetes is much more than a physical condition – and that emotional and psychological demands of living with diabetes should be recognised and support provided.Diabetes Scotland is urgently calling on the NHS to create national standards for diabetes emotional and mental health services. These should ensure everyone receives #joined up# care, that they are asked how they are feeling as part of every diabetes appointment and that a mental health professional with knowledge of diabetes is part of every diabetes care team.To sign our petition, go to diabetes.org.uk missingAngela Mitchell, National Director of Diabetes Scotland.Sir,I#m asking residents in the Highlands and Islands to give their views on Conservative proposals for tackling serious crime.In order to provide Scotland with an alternative to Nicola Sturgeon and the SNP in , we are keen to gain feedback from as many people to our policy proposals to make them as relevant as possible to the needs and aspirations of everyone in Scotland.Too many people in Scotland are affected by the behaviour of serious criminals. This needs to be properly addressed and my colleague Liam Kerr MSP, shadow Justice Secretary, has outlined key policy proposals in a member#s bill in the Scottish Parliament to tackle this scourge.It would give Scottish judges the power to impose whole le sentences to those convicted of the most serious violent and sexual crimes including the murder of a police officer.The courts would still have discretion to impose the appropriate sentence based on all the facts of each case, as they do in England and Wales where such a provision already exists.The proposed Whole Le CustodyBill will not mean the perpetrators of a particular crime will always receive a whole le sentence, but rather that the courts will have the power to impose one where there is sufficient justication.We have started the consultation and experts and members of the public are invited to register their views.Email me at donald.cameron.msp@parliament.scot or write to me at Donald Cameron MSP,  George Street, Oban, PA NT, with your views.MSP Donald Cameron, Highlands and Islands.Sir,The SNP has warned Scotland’s NHS is under threat from a Tory-Trump trade deal that could leave the Scottish Government without a veto over a post-Brexit deal that sells Scotland out.This stark warning follows the revelations from Donald Trump that in terms of trade deals, everything, including the NHS, would be on the table.At Prime Ministers Questions, SNP Deputy Westminster Leader Kirsty Blackman MP said Donald Trump and the Tories could not be trusted on the NHS and criticised the UK government for plotting to take powers away from the Scottish Parliament that would allow it to safeguard Scotland’s NHS.The threats to Scotland#s NHS are growing under the prospect of a hard-right Tory-Trump Brexit trade deal. Those threats could undermine the integrity and independence of our Scottish NHS.The UK Tories will block any potential veto by the Scottish Government over such a damaging deal.The SNP government will fight to the end to defend Scotland#s public services from this unprecedented Tory Brexit danger. Our NHS must remain in public hands. It is not, and should never be, up for sale.Scotland has been completely ignored throughout the Brexit process and Tory plans to grab powers from the Scottish Parliament will leave us even more exposed.It is clearer than ever that the only way to properly protect Scotland#s interests, and keep our NHS in public hands, is with the full powers of independence.MP Brendan O#Hara, Argyll and Bute.

title: improving attitudes to health
story: Barabel McKayUpdated:   , : pmLikeGoogle +TweetEmailWant to  We value our content, so access to our full site is  only available on subscription.Your subscription entitles you to -day-a-week access to our website, plus a full digital copy of that week#s paper to read on your pc mac or mobile device.And there#s more # your subscription includes access to digital archive copies from  onwardsLast year we were studying the Argyll and Bute Health and Social Care Partnership#Transforming Together#   document, which presented a vision of combining our will and skills to create a healthy future for the citizens of Argyll.The promises in that did not translate into reality.Now, a  beautully constructed and presented Living Well document is available. It runs to  pages, and must have taken signicant time and money to produce.It relies heavily on community participation and the Third Sector Interface .While it was being prepared the HSCP was in the process of getting rid of volunteer forums, TSI was shedding staff and Guided Self Help was being transferred to the NHS Mental Health Team, while essential services are still dependent on successful bids for money.Planning must not be a substitute for provision. In Living Well we are told that hypertension is by far the most common long-term condition. This area lacks the yearly health checks which might lead to early detection and intervention.The initiative and enthusiasm of hospital staff in improving mobility have already been commended, but the dearth of professional rehabilitation services in the community is nothing short of a disgrace.Everyone  seems to recognise this # indeed at a recent housing conference the keynote speaker highlighted the need for intervention to halt the downward slide into dependency. In an English trust they have even  appointed a physiotherapist to identy reversible causes of frailty.We have to fight complacency about our own health and in the attitudes of our health care providers.To contact Mid Argyll Health and Care Forum, email the forum chairperson Barabel McKay at barabelmck@gmail

title: kilmartin twinshocks race report
story: Laura MaxwellUpdated:   , : amLikeGoogle +TweetEmailWant to  We value our content, so access to our full site is  only available on subscription.Your subscription entitles you to -day-a-week access to our website, plus a full digital copy of that week#s paper to read on your pc mac or mobile device.And there#s more # your subscription includes access to digital archive copies from  onwardsSubscribe Nowby Jim GrieveRace day on the iconic former Grand Prix track at Carnasserie Castle on June  started off on a sombre note, as riders all paid respects with a minute of silence for fallen riding legendary Ian ‘Lugs’ Robertson.Many riders sported Ian’s riding number  on their bikes.The racing started with group one and the flying EVO cc class with Peter O#Neil, and William Penrice showing the bigger bikes how it should be done. Peter O#Neil edged out Penrice in race one, but Penrice would take his revenge in race two and it was all to play for in the final encounter. Peter O#Neil was up to the task and would take the overall, with Penrice a deserved second and  Damian Carter would third.The four stroke class was enthralling, with Sam Sibbald thundering around the Kilmartin track, big Andy Malloch and his Armstrong chasing him all the way to the flag and winning the final race but not the overall. Sam would be the victor followed by Andy and a consistent Keith Stanford third.For the youth class it was a day of mixed fortunes and consistency would be the key, with Jordan Graham coming out on top ahead of James Forrest and picking up a superb third overall was Rhys Brown.Pre- action would see committee man and track builder Grant McClure and his Maico, with three decades of riding under his belt, become the overall winner ahead of Callum Wilson on the superbly prepared Honda.The Twinshock under cc event would be a three race win for the flying Calum Kilgour and his cc Yamaha ahead of Jim Grieve, who would have some bike issues but would bring home his Honda in second fighting off a very persistent David Lawson and Gordon Peterson but it would be Gordon that would hold the third place trophy with some consistent riding.The Twinshock open class event would be a spectacular sight as cc Hondas and Maicos battled their way around the bracken.In race one there was a very small gap between first and second place and a similarly small gap between third. Brian Alexander would take the win from Craig ‘Smitch’ Smith, and John Crawford would come home in third with a notable mention to the very unlucky Paul Chiappa who had his fair share of misfortunes throughout the day, as his seat was torn from his bike at the top of one of the steep climbs. The overall would end up the same as the first race with Brian, taking the win from Craig Smith and John Crawford bringing the big Honda home in third.In the over s class it was a triumphant day for John Lamont with three resounding victories. Johnny Rutherford was second, a great result for the club sponsor, with David Watson bringing home the Honda with some consistent rides.For the group three races Robert Bell took the honours from Allan Shields and Bryan Colligan, all of these riders deserving a notable mention and with some very similar lap times and some quick racing in trying conditions.The clubman class was great to watch, with some fast up-and-coming riders such as Peter Rennie, Callum Laird and Stuart Wilson all angling for the win. Rennie would take the overall from Laird in second and  Wilson in third.The evolution class was again the Paul and Tom show. In what must have been the fastest racing all day, it would be Paul #PJ# Johnston who would take overall honours with three wins and Tom Grant would take the runner-up slot followed home ably by a consistent Roy Potts taking the third place.In the final block of racing it would be a win apiece for Jordan McDonald, Shaun Robertson, and John Kenny, but it would be the ever improving Shaun Robertson, ing from injury, who would take overall honours from a rapidly improving John Kenny in second and #Mr Consistent# Karl Livingstone in third.Results:Group Pre- class:  Grant McClure  Callum Wilson.
